Dear Ms. Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (866) 685-0006.

ALLEGATION:
Staff was chasing Youth A outside near the swing area. Youth A fell to the ground on
his own. Staff kicked Youth A in the leg. Youth A was seen smiling during the
incident. Staff pointed his finger at youth and was yelling. Youth has no known
injuries from the incident.
INVESTIGATION:
This complaint was received 11/01/2022 and investigated in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist via telephone on 11/02/2022. He
reported Youth A has made tremendous progress in the last two months and the
number or incident reports for Youth A has gone down drastically. He visited Youth
A on 10/24/2022 and Youth A did not express any issues. Foster Care Specialist
reported no concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Director 11/03/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Director reported that he was informed of the incident involving Youth A
and has reviewed the incident report. He reported Youth A did not report being
injured. A body chart was completed, and no injuries found. Staff 1 has been
working at the facility for 4 months and has completed all his training. Staff 1 has
been taken off the schedule pending the investigation.
I interviewed Youth A on 11/03/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with DHHS
Specialist. Youth A smiled and started to laugh when asked about the allegations.
He reported while outside he was playing with Staff 1 and slapped Staff 1 on the
neck. Staff 1 started to run after Youth A and Staff 1 fell on the ground. Staff 1 got up
and continued to chase Youth A and Youth A tripped and fell on the ground. Youth A
said Staff 1 playfully kicked him, but he did not get hurt or have any injuries. He and
Staff 1 were playing around, and he was having fun with Staff 1. He said Staff 1 did
tell him not to play around like that, but he likes teasing and playing with staff. Youth
A was smiling and laughing throughout the interview. Youth A reported feeling safe
and expressed no concerns regarding any staff member.
I interviewed Youth B on 11/03/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Youth B reported he gets enough to eat, gets his medication daily, and
feels safe. Youth B said he likes Staff 1 and feels that he is always fair with all the
3

residents. Youth B was outside on the day in question but denied witnessing Staff 1
kicking Youth A or any other youth at the facility.
I interviewed Complainant/Therapist on 11/03/2022 at the facility, in collaboration
with the DHHS Specialist. Therapist reported on 11/01/2022 she witnessed Staff 1
chasing Youth A, Staff 1 fell but got up and continued to chase Youth A, then Youth
A fell to the ground. Staff 1 walked up to Youth A after he fell and kicked him. She
heard Staff 1 telling Youth A, “I told you not to put your hands on me.” She said
Youth A was laughing when he was being chased and when he was on ground.
Youth A was still smiling and laughing after Staff 1 walked away. She said Youth A
did not look upset or in distress after the incident.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on11/03/2022, in collaboration with the DHHS Specialist.
Supervisor 1 reported he was not working on 11/01/2022 but was informed of the
incident. He said there are no previous incidents involving Staff 1 being rough or
horseplaying with the youths. He said Staff 1 has a very positive attitude and all the
residents like him.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 11/03/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Staff 2 has been working at the facility for one month and has completed
all his training including CPI. Staff 2 was working the afternoon of 11/01/2022. He
was outside and witnessed Youth A smack Staff 1 on the neck and ran off laughing.
He said Youth A wanted Staff 1 to run after him. He said Staff 1 ran after Youth A
playing around. He did not witness Staff 1 kick or yell at Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 11/07/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Staff 1 has been working at the facility for four months and has completed
all his training. Staff 1 reported on the day in question, he and Staff 3 were helping
another youth and Youth A ran up to him and hit him on the arm. Youth A took off
running and laughing. Staff 1 admitted he chased Youth A and fell on ground. Staff 1
said he got up and began chasing Youth A again and that’s when Youth A tripped
and fell. Staff 1 reported he playfully kicked at Youth A’s leg and said, "stop playing
so much." Staff 1 denied he connected on the kick, and it said it was a playful kick.
Staff 1 reported he has a good relationship with all the youths and especially Youth
A. He admitted that he should not have run after Youth A, but he has good rapport
with the residents and was being playful.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 11/07/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Staff 3 has been working at the facility for 16 months and works in
Burnham cottage, she reported on the day in question she observed Staff 1 chasing
Youth A. Staff 3 saw Staff 1 trip and fall when he was chasing Youth A but got up
and continued to chase Youth A. She said Youth A was laughing and it appeared
that staff and youth were playing with each other. Staff 3 did not observe Youth A
smack Staff 1or Staff 1 kick Youth A.
4

I interviewed Youth C on 11/07/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Youth 3 stated on the day in question, he was outside but was not paying
attention and did not see Staff 1 chasing Youth A. Youth C admitted seeing Staff 1
standing by Youth 1, but he did not witness Staff 1 kick Youth A. Youth C reported
feeling safe and expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility’s Residential Treatment Overview/ Behavior management policy.
• Body chart for Youth A completed by Clinical Director on 11/02/2022. No
bruises or marks.
• Incident report dated 11/01/2022, completed by Therapist 1. Report is
consistent with Therapist 1’s interview.
• Youth A’s treatment plan.
• Staff 1’s employee file, No disciplinary action reports.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
ANALYSIS: The facility is in violation of the rule as Staff 1 demonstrated a lack
of experience in performing the duties of the position assigned
evidenced by Staff 1 chasing Youth A and play kicking the youth.
Staff chasing youth and horseplaying with youth is not
recommended and jeopardizes youths’ safety. Staff 1 has only
worked at the facility for four months and used poor judgment in
responding to the youth playful actions. It is anticipated that
additional training and supervision will be a part of the facility’s
corrective action plan.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility submitting an
acceptable corrective action plan for the noted violation.
